name: HATS-53
scenarioDescription:
The HATS-53 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HATS-53 is a star with 0.96 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.1 times its radius. It is located 1999.34 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 9 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HATS-53 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HATS-53 system


HATS-53 b

HATS-53 b was discovered by the HATSouth observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.05 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HATS-53 b is 189.20999999999998 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HATS-53 b is 15.02 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HATS-53 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HATS-53, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by HATSouth.
